content: What American author wrote "The Great Gatsby", a novel set in the Jazz Age that critiques the idea of the American Dream?

F. Scott Fitzgerald is the American author who wrote "The Great Gatsby," a renowned novel set in the Jazz Age that critiques the idea of the American Dream. This literary masterpiece explores themes of decadence, idealism, resistance to change, social upheaval, and excess, all of which were characteristic of the Roaring Twenties in the United States.
